intro: Mammillaria kleinschmidtiana, commonly known as the Kleinschmidt's bunny ear cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is characterized by its globular shape and dense covering of white to pale blue spines. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and has a compact, rounded appearance. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in late spring or early summer. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and requires well-draining soil and minimal water.
